title.narrative: 4 shelters, women's rights organizations and state institutions (primary partners or secondary/indirect partners) are addressing VAW in the public and/or private sphere due to increased level and/or improved quality of awareness raising/advocacy.

4 shelters, women's rights organizations and state institutions (primary partners or secondary/indirect partners) are addressing VAW in the public and/or private sphere due to increased level and/or improved quality of awareness raising/advocacy.

48 shelters, women's rights organizations and public institutions (primary partners or secondary/indirect partners) are addressing VAW in the public and/or private sphere due to increased level and/or improved quality of awareness raising/advocacy.

48 shelters, women's rights organizations and public institutions (primary partners or secondary/indirect partners) are addressing VAW in the public and/or private sphere due to increased level and/or improved quality of awareness raising/advocacy.
At least 3 new initiatives focusing on combating VAW on national level in Egypt have been described

description.narrative: A number of new initiatives and ideas covering earlier gaps in the field of combating VAW both politically and socially in Egypt have been developed. As a result of a conference, an expert group of NGO representatives has been established to continue dialogue on how to combat VAW in Egypt.

title.narrative: The capacity of MENA organizations trained by Danner in the field of VAW is improved by receiving training material to be used for brushing up skills acquired during training courses

description.narrative: Ongoing. Training material produced in fall 2016 will be shared with MENA organizations as all material has been collected and added to website in spring 2017

title.narrative: Strengthening the preparedness for handling VAW in public and private spheres

description.narrative: Organizations from different MENA countries with improved shelter policies and/or practices as a result of traning (capacity building)

title.narrative: One in depth awareness raising training for religious leaders is held in Egypt and has led to the mobilization of a group of key religious leaders, who can advocate for an enhanced understanding of the negative impact of violence and how to support victim

description.narrative: Participating religious leaders have been introduced to alternative narratives about the negative impact of domestic violence, thus contributing to greater awareness on the area and possible action to prevent violence.

title.narrative: One in depth awareness raising training for religious leaders is held in Egypt and has led to the mobilization of a group of key religious leaders, who can advocate for an enhanced understanding of the negative impact of violence and how to support victim

description.narrative: Participating religious leaders have been introduced to alternative narratives about the negative impact of domestic violence, thus contributing to greater awareness on the area and possible action to prevent violence.

title.narrative: The study report on the extent of domestic violence is used by NGO's as a means to raise awareness on VAW and to feed into national policies on the area of VAW and participants express that they have learned more about domestic violence in Egypt.

description.narrative: Participating stakeholders (duty bearers) have been informed about the extent of domestic violence in Egypt based on research study conducted by CEWLA in 2015.

title.narrative: The study report on the extent of domestic violence is used by NGO's as a means to raise awareness on VAW and to feed into national policies on the area of VAW and participants express that they have learned more about domestic violence in Egypt.

description.narrative: Participating stakeholders (duty bearers) have been informed about the extent of domestic violence in Egypt based on research study conducted by CEWLA in 2015.

title.narrative: Internal review in the two organizations in terms of current practices related to work with VAW (nationally and internationally), advocacy and awareness raising is prepared.

description.narrative: Sharing of professional knowledge and experiences between Danner and CEWLA has led to an internal review of current practices in terms of work with VAW, advocacy and awareness raising in each organization

title.narrative: The ToT project has been improved with new training modules contributing to the qualification of staff and volunteers at women's shelters and counselling centres (duty bearers) and hereby strengthening the quality of services provided to women and childre

description.narrative: The capacity of staff and volunteers at women's shelters and counselling centres has improved through the ToT project so as to provide a better service to end beneficiaries.

title.narrative: At least 1 partner from each of the countries of our programme has joined the new network/regional observatory on VAW. 75% of interviewed members of the network/observatory express that they think joining the network and dialogue will increase their impac

description.narrative: The speakers expressed the improvements in the cooperation between partner NGOs. This cooperation will have good impact on networking in MENA, but especially on dialogue and fight against violence.

title.narrative: Improved cooperation between CSOs and public institutions on VAW

description.narrative: This has been partly achieved as the project has contributed to a better understanding of VAW from both perspectives.

title.narrative: Strengthening the preparedness for handling VAW in public and private spheres

description.narrative: Through training at least 60 staff members, shelter policies and/or practices of at least six MENA organisations froom at least five MENA countries are improved as a result of knowledge, skills and attitudes acquired throough training

title.narrative: Strengthening the preparedness for handling VAW in public and private spheres

description.narrative: Through training at least 60 staff members, shelter policies and/or practices of at least six MENA organisations froom at least five MENA countries are improved as a result of knowledge, skills and attitudes acquired throough training

comment.narrative: Many shelters lack staff, services are provided by volunteers, and there is lack of professionalization. Reluctance by some organisations to enter into networks.
